Class com.penthera.virtuososdk.client.Virtuoso
Inherited members: ShowHide

com.penthera.virtuososdk.client

Class Virtuoso

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.penthera.virtuososdk.client.Virtuoso
  • public class Virtuoso extends java.lang.Object
    The main class for interacting with Virtuoso
    Use this class to:
    • Create concrete implementations of Virtuoso asset interfaces
    • Enqueue Assets for download
    • Register observers for notification of Virtuoso events
    • Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Virtuoso 
      Virtuoso(android.content.Context c)
      Creates a new Virtuoso instance, but without registering an observer for notification when the background service is connected.
      public Virtuoso(android.content.Context c)
      Creates a new Virtuoso instance, but without registering an observer for notification when the background service is connected. Uses default Virtuoso settings.
      Parameters:
      c - Context to use for registering observers.
      Throws:
      java.lang.RuntimeException - if it was not possible to ascertain the authority of the client's content provider
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if context is null.
      • Starting Up 
        Modifier and Type Method and Description
        startup 
        void startup(java.net.URL aBackplaneUrl, java.lang.String aUser, java.lang.String aExternalDeviceID, java.lang.String aPublicKey, java.lang.String aPrivateKey, IPushRegistrationObserver aPushRegistrationObserver)
        You must call this method so that Virtuoso can register itself with the Backplane.
        public void startup(java.net.URL aBackplaneUrl, java.lang.String aUser, java.lang.String aExternalDeviceID, java.lang.String aPublicKey, java.lang.String aPrivateKey, IPushRegistrationObserver aPushRegistrationObserver)
        You must call this method so that Virtuoso can register itself with the Backplane. Once this method is successful, you need never call this method again unless updating keys or switching users.

        You'll need to call this if AuthenticationStatus==AuthenticationStatus.NOT_AUTHENTICATED.

        Registering with the Backplane allows the device to fetch global configuration values for download behavior and windowing rules. It allows Virtuoso to post events to the Backplane and receive push notifications from the Backplane. It allows the Backplane to police the number of allowable download-enabled devices per user.

        Successful registration or failures are reported through the requestComplete callback in IBackplaneObserver with a callback type of BackplaneCallbackType.REGISTER.
        Retrieve the current authentication status by calling authenticationStatus.

        When calling this method the following holds true:
        1) If between calls the User Id changes then the SDK will reset. It will delete all existing files and reset the user data before attempting to register the new user with the Backplane.
        2) If between calls ONLY the keys are changed then the SDK will store the new values and attempt to sync in order to get a new license.
        3) If between calls the keys and User Id change then the SDK will perform all actions from condition (1) and will also delete any outstanding events that need to be reported to the Backplane.
        4) If AuthenticationStatus==AuthenticationStatus.AUTHENTICATED and there are no changes to the keys or User id then this is a NOOP and no callbacks will be performed.

        Parameters:
        aBackplaneUrl - Backplane URL
        aUser - User ID to associate with this Device on the Backplane
        aExternalDeviceID - (Optional; can be null) Externally defined device ID. Virtuoso will maintain this so you can refer to this device with this handle.
        aPublicKey - Public key used to encrypt HTTP requests made to the Backplane. Get this from Penthera.
        aPrivateKey - Private key used to encrypt requests made to the Backplane. Get this from Penthera.
        aPushRegistrationObserver - Observer for monitoring whether the push registration is successful
        See Also:
        Observers.IBackplaneObserver

      • Handling Observers 
        Modifier and Type Method and Description
        addObserver 
        void addObserver(Observers.IObserver obs)
        Add an Observer.
        public void addObserver(Observers.IObserver obs)
        Add an Observer. If the passed-in observer implements more than one of the Virtuoso Observer interfaces, then each interface will be registered with Virtuoso.

        Refer to the documentation on SDK Observers to see what types of observers are available.
        Parameters:
        obs - The observer
        See Also:
        Observers.IQueueObserver, Observers.IEngineObserver, Observers.IBackplaneObserver, Observers.ISubscriptionObserver
        removeObserver 
        void removeObserver(Observers.IObserver obs)
        Remove an Observer.
        public void removeObserver(Observers.IObserver obs)
        Remove an Observer. If the passed-in observer implements more than one of the Virtuoso Observer interfaces, all of those interfaces will be removed.
        Parameters:
        obs - The observer to remove
        See Also:
        Observers.IQueueObserver, Observers.IEngineObserver, Observers.IBackplaneObserver, Observers.ISubscriptionObserver

        getAllowableStorageRemaining 
        long getAllowableStorageRemaining()
        Total amount of storage available to Virtuoso for downloaded assets
        This value is not the total space on disk.
        public long getAllowableStorageRemaining()
        Total amount of storage available to Virtuoso for downloaded assets
        This value is not the total space on disk. It is the value of storage permitted after the headroom and max storage settings have been applied.
        Returns:
        Total amount of storage available, in MB

        long getStorageUsed()

        Manually register an asset with a feed, to be considered in enforcement of subscription business rules.
        Parameters:
        aId - Id of the asset to add to the feed
        feedUuid - Feed UUID
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a feed identified by feedUuid does not exist.
        getFeedCanDelete 
        boolean getFeedCanDelete(java.lang.String feedUuid)
        Current value for the auto-delete rule on a particular feed.
        public boolean getFeedCanDelete(java.lang.String feedUuid)
        Current value for the auto-delete rule on a particular feed. Overrides the default value for subscribed feeds.
        To get the global value for feeds, use the ISettings.getCanAutoDeleteForSubscriptions() method.
        This rule applies when Virtuoso is already storing "max number of assets" for a feed and a new episode is available for download in that feed.
        Parameters:
        feedUuid - Feed UUID
        Returns:
        If true, Virtuoso will automatically delete old episodes when new episodes become available.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if feed does not exist.
        See Also:
        SubscriptionsService
        getFeedDownloadInSequence 
        boolean getFeedDownloadInSequence(java.lang.String feedUuid)
        Current value for the download rule on a particular feed.
        public boolean getFeedDownloadInSequence(java.lang.String feedUuid)
        Current value for the download rule on a particular feed.

        The download rule dictates whether Virtuoso will download the latest asset in the feed or the next one in the sequence.

        Parameters:
        feedUuid - Feed UUID
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if feed does not exist.
        See Also:
        SubscriptionsService
        getFeedMaxAssets 
        int getFeedMaxAssets(java.lang.String feedUuid)
        Retrieve the value for the "max number of assets" rule of an individual feed.
        public int getFeedMaxAssets(java.lang.String feedUuid)

        getFeedMaxBitRate 
        int getFeedMaxBitRate(java.lang.String feedUuid)
        Get the max bitrate for segmented assets in the feed.
        public int getFeedMaxBitRate(java.lang.String feedUuid)
        Get the max bitrate for segmented assets in the feed. This is the maximum bitrate that Virtuoso will use when downloading segments belonging to episodes in this feed. To get the default maximum value, use the ISettings.getMaxBitrateForSubscriptions() method.

        Returns:

        Throws:

        SubscriptionsService
        getSubscriptions 
        void getSubscriptions()
        Asynchronously retrieve a list of subscriptions.
        public void getSubscriptions()
        Asynchronously retrieve a list of subscriptions. In other words, feed UUIDs that this instance is subscribed to. To retrieve the data, callers must implement the ISubscriptionsObserver interface. Subscription UUIDs are returned as a String Array in the onSubscriptions of the observer.
        See Also:
        Observers.ISubscriptionObserver.onSubscriptions(int, java.lang.String[])
        setFeedCanDelete 
        void setFeedCanDelete(java.lang.String feedUuid, boolean canDelete)
        Set the auto-delete rule for an individual feed.
        public void setFeedCanDelete(java.lang.String feedUuid, boolean canDelete)
        Set the auto-delete rule for an individual feed. Overrides the default rule for subscribed feeds.
        To assign auto-delete properties on a global basis, use the ISettings.setCanAutoDeleteForSubscriptions(boolean) method.
        The auto-delete rule dictates whether Virtuoso will delete old episodes to make room for new episodes.

        This rule applies when Virtuoso is already storing "max number of assets" for a feed and a new episode is available for download in that feed.
        Parameters:
        feedUuid - Feed UUID
        canDelete - True if Virtuoso can delete old episodes from the feed when new episodes become available
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if feed does not exist.
        See Also:
        SubscriptionsService
        setFeedDownloadInSequence 
        void setFeedDownloadInSequence(java.lang.String feedUuid, boolean downloadInSequence)
        Set the download rule for an individual feed.
        public void setFeedDownloadInSequence(java.lang.String feedUuid, boolean downloadInSequence)
        Set the download rule for an individual feed.

        The download rule dictates whether Virtuoso will download the latest asset in the feed or the next one in the sequence.

        Parameters:
        feedUuid - Feed UUID
        downloadInSequence - True if Virtuoso should download the next asset sequentially, false to download the newest asset only.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if feed does not exist.
        See Also:
        SubscriptionsService
        setFeedMaxAssets 
        void setFeedMaxAssets(java.lang.String feedUuid, int max)
        Set the "max number of items" rule for an individual feed.
        public void setFeedMaxAssets(java.lang.String feedUuid, int max)
        Set the "max number of items" rule for an individual feed. To set the default value to be used with all new feeds, use the ISettings.setMaxAssetsForSubscriptions(int) method. This rule applies when Virtuoso is already storing "max number of assets" for a feed and a new episode is available for download in that feed.
        Parameters:
        feedUuid - Feed UUID the rule is to be applied to
        max - Desired maximum number of episodes allowed in the feed, <=0 is evaluated as Integer.MAX_VALUE.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if feed does not exist.
        See Also:
        SubscriptionsService
        setFeedMaxBitRate 
        void setFeedMaxBitRate(java.lang.String feedUuid, int bitrate)
        Set the maximum bitrate for segmented assets in a feed.
        public void setFeedMaxBitRate(java.lang.String feedUuid, int bitrate)
        Set the maximum bitrate for segmented assets in a feed. Overrides the default value for the "max bitrate" rule on subscribed feeds. To set a global value for the max bitrate rule, use the ISettings.setMaxBitrateForSubscriptions(int) method.
        Parameters:
        feedUuid - Feed UUID
        bitrate - Maximum bitrate to be used with segmented assets in the feed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if feed does not exist.
        See Also:
        SubscriptionsService
        subscribe 
        void subscribe(java.lang.String feedUuid)
        Subscribe to a feed.
        public void subscribe(java.lang.String feedUuid)
        Subscribe to a feed.

        Caller must implement ISubscriptionsObserver to verify this operation succeeded.

        Parameters:
        feedUuid - Feed UUID
        See Also:
        Observers.ISubscriptionObserver
        subscribe 
        void subscribe(java.lang.String feedUuid, int maxEpisodes, boolean canDelete, int maxBitRate, boolean downloadSequentially)
        Subscribe to a feed, providing values to configure behavior of feed.
        public void subscribe(java.lang.String feedUuid, int maxEpisodes, boolean canDelete, int maxBitRate, boolean downloadSequentially)
        Subscribe to a feed, providing values to configure behavior of feed.

        Callers must implement ISubscriptionsObserver to verify this operation succeeded

        Parameters:
        feedUuid - Feed UUID
        maxEpisodes - Quota limiting the number of episodes belonging to this feed that can live on the device at one time (Certain non-subscription-related actions, such as a manual download request from the user, may cause the number of downloaded episodes in a feed to exceed this number.).
        canDelete - Policy for when Virtuoso is already storing "max episodes per feed" for a feed and a new episode is available for download in that feed. If true, Virtuoso will auto-delete the oldest (by download-complete timestamp) episode and then download the new episode. If false, Virtuoso will not download the new episode.
        maxBitRate - The max bit rate to use when downloading a segmented asset
        downloadSequentially - Download rule for the feed. When true Virtuoso will download the next asset in the feed. If false Virtuoso will download the most recent asset.
        See Also:
        Observers.ISubscriptionObserver
        unsubscribe 
        void unsubscribe(java.lang.String feedUuid)
        Unsubscribe from a feed.
        public void unsubscribe(java.lang.String feedUuid)
        Unsubscribe from a feed.

        Caller must implement ISubscriptionsObserver to verify this operation succeeded.

        Parameters:
        feedUuid - Feed UUID
        See Also:
        Observers.ISubscriptionObserver

        getService 
        IService getService()
        Handle for binding to the background service and making direct calls.
        public IService getService()
        Handle for binding to the background service and making direct calls.
        Some calls within Virtuoso require direct communication with the background download service. These calls consist of pausing / resuming downloads, ascertaining current status of the service and retrieving network throughput data. This interface provides the means for clients to create a persistent connection only when they need it.
        Returns:
        Interface for binding and making direct calls to the service
        See Also:
        IService
        onPause

        Unregister any observers and unbind from the background service.
        public void onPause()
        Unregister any observers and unbind from the background service. Must be called in onPause of an activity.

        Bind to the background service.
        public void onResume()
